events.message: The customer reported an auto collision that occurred on 2024-04-30 involving their vehicle and another car at a busy intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under 'Auto Accident' based on the description of the vehicle collision and accident details.
An insurance agent has been assigned to the case to assist the customer with the auto accident claim process and next steps.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and assured the customer that assistance is underway.
The customer was asked to provide photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and any medical bills related to the accident injuries.
Customer submitted all required documents including photos of the damaged car, police report, and an initial estimate from the repair shop.
The claims investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and contacted witnesses to verify details of the auto collision.
Investigation concluded confirming the other driver was at fault, and the damages claimed are consistent with the reported accident.
Based on the investigation findings, a settlement amount was proposed to the customer covering vehicle repair and injury expenses.
The customer responded to the settlement offer, requesting clarification on some repair costs and timeline for payment issuance.
After addressing the customer’s concerns, the claim was officially approved for the full proposed settlement amount without deductions.
The insurance company issued payment to the customer’s bank account to cover all agreed costs related to the auto accident claim.
The auto accident claim case was closed after confirming the customer had received payment and was satisfied with the resolution.
Final case documents and records of the auto accident claim were archived in the insurance system for future reference.
